column4: Cosy restaurant with real Italian ambiance and good food and beer. They offer tasty gluten-free pizza, not easily available. Fair priced. Would return.
Rude rude rude host service. I don’t care if it’s the best pizza in NY if you have a rude staff. At the end, your paying them but I guess they forget about that...very common in NY.
Great place. Service was polite and easy going Food really tasty. My teen kids loved it. Really cosy with great atmosphere
Great pizzas and a buzzy authentic atmosphere. Only criticism was the imported Italian IPA beer which we were charges $16/ bottle for!
Went here for lunch and had fantastic pizza and gf pizza!!! Best we had on the trip! Recommend reservations, as it’s very busy.

Always crowded and feels rushed to some extent, but worth it because the food is so good! The pizza is superb, but everything we have tried, from most all of the appetizers to pastas, is delicious and fresh.
We visited Little Italy twice during our trip because we loved the food so much! Great atmosphere, attentive waitress and the food was to die for!
Came in early on a Wednesday because this place is always busy. Food and service were good, but nothing crazy

column3: Sweet spot for a drink and a pie.
column4: Excellent Za and best baked octopus ever. Good drinks, friendly staff, decent prices. What's not to like?
This was the tastiest Italian food I have had in ages! We had to wait 45 minutes for a table, but it was worth it!

Best pizza we have found on the edge of Little Italy and the price is right. We lucked on a cosy table and were well looked after all night. Good beers too. Be prepared to wait as it is popular for good reason.

column3: Recommended by a friend and lived up to it.
column4: Really enjoyed the friendly service and excellent food. Obviously popular with local folk, looking at the nearby tables.

I am sure there are many great places for pizza in New York, however the Vodka pizza at Rubirosa is the best pizza I have ever had. We asked to add pepperoni. We dined there twice. If my trip was longer would have gone again.
Every time we come to NYC we make a point to go to Rubirosa. The Caesar salad is great. Try the Tie Dye. You won’t regret it.
Can someone say thin crust? Can someone say melt in your mouth calamari fritti? Worth the wait at this little hot spot in Little Italy. Great menu with wonderful variety.
Found Rubirosa via a local’s recommendation. It did not disappoint. Lots of people in small space makes for perfect nyc experience. Specialty pizza was superb! Will be back!
Found Rubirosa via a local’s recommendation. It did not disappoint. Lots of people in small space makes for perfect nyc experience. Specialty pizza was superb! Will be back!

column3: Hidden gem in Little Italy - Avoid tourist traps and head here!!!
column4: I had this place on my list to visit in NYC. Place is small, and it was packed for a Sunday afternoon. We came here after a visit to the Brooklyn bridge and were hungry. They gave us a table near the bathroom. There is...More

Walked in on a Saturday around 4 pm as a couple and were seated right away. We started with the meatballs as an appetizer and they were delicious! Then ordered a simple Caesar salad and large classic cheese pizza. Overall the food was very good but we had such high expectations of the pizza based on the other reviews and thought the crust was lacking flavor. We ended up just leaving the crust and not eating it as it was dry and hard. I would definitely go back but would like to try one of the other pizzas on the menu like the supreme.

column3: Great pizza, very good starters, entrance service to improve
column4: The place is small but cozy. It's noisy but if you have ever been in Italy you'll find it as part of the dinner. I do recommend to order any kind of pizza as it's really delicious. I don't recommend any pasta, but grilled octopus as entrance is really delicious. On the cons side I'd like to share that lady on the entrance is not guest friendly at all. She has informed us they not do booking at all and that we have to come in 45 min to get a table because they will have available one at that time. Finally when we came she has told us that there is no place, because we have to book the table in 30 days prior to our date of dinner (???!!!). I assume she has sold our table to someone else. It was really disappointed because we have invited our friends and recommended the food is really great there but finally we have to choose another place. 5 stars for food, 3 stars for service = 4 in average. Sorry for that.

This was recommended to us by two different people and it did not disappoint! The restaurant was a little noisy but patrons near us were kind and we had the most delicious dinner. We cannot get this type of pizza where we live so can be critical and grateful. There are no complaints on the pizza or salad (including size - fed 3 of us!). They offered to split our pizza and prep in two halves which was perfect for us. Wine and appetizers were delicious, as well. We had the calamari and loved it! The marinara used for that dish was incredible! I am dreaming of having this again soon...

Loved the pizza at this little restaurant. Got in without a reservation at 5 o'clock. There was a line outside afterward. Had the 1/2 Bianca, 1/2 Tie Dye--both were great with a thin crispy crust. . Sat in the back by the kitchen, which was actually a little roomier than the front section.

We spent a fab weekend in the city for the John Mayer concert. I ate pizza and bagels all weekend but this place had in my opinion the best of all the places we tried, Just thinking about it makes my mouth water. I am planning my next trip to NY just for the pizza. Please do yourself a favor and go there.

We visited Rubirosa in May after hearing good reviews. We booked 40 days in advance and were pleased we did.  Our waitress was welcoming and friendly and explained the menu and options too us.  We ordered ricotta ravioli with butter and a large vodka tie dye pizza.  Food was delicious, I will be recommending this place to everyone who visits NYC.  On our next trip we will have to visit more then once.

The classic think crust pizza is outstanding! Vodka sauce option is a good twist but can’t top the original. Simple and delicious. This takes pizza to a new level. Wait was over an hour on a late Saturday afternoon but put your name in, walk around the neighborhood, and wait for the text that the table is ready. Tight on space, but somehow the servers come and go with ease. Very attentive and friendly staff. No attitude. Full bar. Only one restroom I could see and there was a line.

We had a party of 10 so we made reservations for the first seating and it was definitely necessary as there was a line formed prior to opening. Service was fast and helpful to make sure didn't order too much. We had the supreme pizza, the classic pizza and an assortment of pasta. Everything was amazing! EVERYTHING! This place is a must try!

We shared two different pizzas, both vegetarian friendly, and it was such a pleasing experience, from the quality of the food to the atmosphere in the place. Would highly recommend to anyone stopping by NYC.
We visited Rubirosa for the first time and I have to say it was the best pizza I have ever tasted. It was that good we went back the next day!!!
I know the drill in terms of pizzas and this one is among the best I had the chance to try in the US.
Little Italy’s hidden gem!!! We never EVER miss an opportunity to come grab a pie or two and rice balls. You haven’t eaten pizza until you’ve eaten here.
Pizza really tasty thin crust just perfect loved IT probally best in New York CITY would visit again ..

We split 3 pizzas between 5 starving females. Not a slice remained. Great price point for a group. Booth was small but felt intimate rather than cramped. We showed up at 11:45am on a Saturday and were seated immediately.
Cute restaurant with giant and good pizzas. Arrive early (like 6pm) to have a table without waiting.

Was looking for a NYC Pizza experience and can thoroughly recommend Rubirosa. Great staff, great atmosphere and great pizza - happy to do half and half pizza's which makes for sharing experience. Well worth a trip if you are in the area.
Great cocktails followed by a varied menu (except for vegans). Having said that, I wasn't disappointed as the chef ensured I got to eat a delicious pasta to a vegan recipe. We loved it.
Dude, if you want real New York Pizza THIS IS THE PLACE The pizza is AWESOME!!! The beer is cold, the service was great. Two hour wait but it is ok!!!!
Amazing pizza. Highly recommend the vodka pizza and Rubirosa supreme. As thin as they can be. The crust, the tomato sauce and toppings are just perfect! 👌🏻
I've been to Rome and Naples, tasted pizza there, but this..this is the best pizza ever created by mankind! You are definetely have to check it out.

Simply one of the best pizzas we’ve had. There is more than enough to share a pizza between two and it is surprisingly good value compared to other restaurants in the area. It looks like booking is needed a fair bit in advance!
Found this hidden gem while walking by. Thin crust pizza, great sauce, quick service and yummy drinks. Good value, great pizza.
Solid meatball hero and definitely suggest it. Its a small place so tough to get a table, but definitely worth the wait and experience.

column3: Good place to enjoy a good meal
column4: The place and the food was very good, the only problem costumer service was a little slow, the server took time to bring the food out and she hardly came back to do the drink refill.
I love coming to Rubirosa, I make sure to make a stop here while visiting. One of my favorite pizza places in the city!!! Great service too. Cant wait to come back :)

Rubirosa definitely lives up to the name! Their classic pizza was authentic New York style. Super tasty and delicious! The service was the also amazing! Super attentive and extremely friendly! Order the Rubirosa salad, you will not be disappointed!

Really nice restaurant. You can eat a fantastic italian pizza. The taste was like in italy. The service and the personal is perfect. The restaurant has a lot of guest so you have to wait about 30 minutes to get a place.

Really.You pay this much for a pizza.Thin crust barely any topping wait for one and half hours for table.No better than the two dollar pizza on the street.Please spare me and I hope this review spares you

OMG the best Pizza I have ever had , the fact the shaving of cheese drizzled in balsamic vinegar was not grilled / melted left this dish tasting superb. The place was busy and buzzing , booking is recommend.
We stopped in by chance and were glad we did! The pizza and pasta was fantastic! Great little find, we will be definitely be back!

Amazing service,tasty pizza everything perfect.We were here 2 years ago and we returned because of the service and beautiful food.For sure we will come back next year. :) suggest to everyone this place!!!Perfection in one word!
Arugula Classic with pepperoni Rubirosa suprema All great taste, thin crust, will come back. Real nice service.
A great place for those who like thin crust and innovative pizza. The place is somewhat small and cramped but it’s pizza makes up for it. The vodka and mozzarella pizza is a must!! Enjoy!
Best Caesar salad I ever had (add anchovies!) Hand squeezed lemonade and perfect thin crust NY classic pizza. Will be back.
Chicago pizza oven baked American slice! Great atmosphere and the flavour of the slice was tremendous! Well worth a visit!

We started with the meatballs and calamari both were great but the meatballs were the star. Ordered a pizza to share , pepperoni and meatball. Yea, that was great as well. Nice location to then walk around little Italy after.
I got a recommendation for Rubirosa and it was one of the best pizza I´ve ever had. For two, you can share one bigger size, pizza´s are huge. Great vodka pizza, wonderful! I enjoyed it so much!

What a wonderful surprise! Everything gf we tried at Rubirosa (on Mulberry Street ) was exceptional and we thank the smiling and well-prepared waiter for his reassurance of the gf dish offered. His wine suggestion was also excellent. A definite eat out👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻

column3: Great Italian American pizza with great atmosphere
column4: Great little place with great vibe. Went for lunch and the place was buzzing. Pizzas are expensive and limited in choice but great quality. Sat at the bar because the place was so busy, but loved the vibe and general ambiance.

Stopped in here during the famed San Gennaro feast & was very happy I did. They have gluten free pizza and pasta, and the GF pizza was delicious!! Also full bar + wine list, and excellent service. A bit crowded but totally worth it!
We tried an appetizer, pasta and a couple of pizzas, accompanied with some beers. Everything just great! Will go again during my one week in NY.

column3: Great pizza only overshadowed by great cocktails
column4: Had dinner here during a street festival, so the place was packed! Our waitress was attentive and friendly. The thin crust pizza =amazing. Would go back in a heartbeat
The size is so large, the pizza is thin and crunchy. We ordered the arugula one. The wine is good too.
Amazing. Delicious pizza and food. The greatest pizza spot in NYC. Just ensure you book a reservation or go on an off time during the week.

column3: The best pasta in the world!
column4: I absolute LOVE Rubirosa! Every time I visit NYC I book a table. This restaurant serves the most amazing pasta - always try the special!
Honestly I cannot say better things than this restaurant. AWESOME service and delicious pizza... I can say just as good as pizza from ITALY! mmmm... i want more....
Great pizza but the wait is ridiculous. First we were told an hour and fifteen minutes. In total we waited close to two hours. No pizza is worth that. Plus the place is loud and cramped.

Stumbled upon this place; had no idea about it's reputation. Must have hit it right at opening time. One table ahead of us, and 5 minutes later it was full! Tie dye pizza was to die for!!! Cant wait to come back!!
Amazing pizza in New York! And I say this as an Italian! It’s really worth a visit, but get there early if you can, as the pizza is amazing, it’s always quite crowded.

column3: Great Italian with the best service
column4: I would only have good things to say. Great pasta and salads. Good and quiet «lounge» away from the busy Broadway street. Cool restaurant in Soho.
Fantastic NYC style pizza with fresh ingredients and thin crusts. \We shared 1 large half and half (enormous) and a charcuterie board to start. Service was great, interior very cosy and inviting.
Pizza was really good. Staff was super friendly and service minded. If i ever come back to new york this is a restaurant to visit again.
Definitely try the rice balls! Squid ink seafood pasta, rigatoni, cavatelli, and blue crab pasta were all delicious.
Great pizza!!! Service was good. Small place but is worth it. Price was reasonable. First time in little Italy and we liked it.
The food, the service, the atmosphere- all amazing! The carbonara, ricotta ravioli and vodka pizza were so good. So were the charcuterie and rice balls. A great start to a weekend in NYC.
Such a wonderful little joint. Always provides a great experience with excellent service and delightful food. Highly recommend - you won’t be disappointed! Pizzas are delicious!

column3: A Pizza Worth Coming Over from London for !!
column4: Superb experience - was on a "pizza-high" for two hours ... great portions, great food, great beer, great atmosphere
Amazing food and quaint atmosphere, my bf and I loved eating here on our trip to Manhattan & would highly recommend.
Good taste and fresh ingredients. Very good portion size. Many vegetarian friendly options. Good service.

Was recommended this place from our hotell staff! When we got there the atmosphere was amazing, loud, cozy, and the best pizza in the history of my Pizza tasting! Crispy and full of flavor! We had the pizza with meatballs and pepperoni🍕 Just epic👍👍👍

column3: Must be something in the dough!
column4: I tried the tie-dye pizza here and it was delicious. I've tried a lot of pizza joints here but for some reason this place tops them. Must be something in the dough.

The pizza is amazing, very thin and crispy crust. Service is lovely. One pizza is enough for 2 to shares - at least 2 Europeans 😄. You can also order half and half pizza which is great. Thanks a lot to Rubirosa!
Honestly, I haven’t had a better Italian in my life and I’m Italian (except home cooking of course)... the Spaghetti was out of this world.
First had the tie dyed pizza and other stuff with my wife, then ordered for delivery too. Have a snack before you go. It’s worth the wait.

column3: doesn't live up to its reputation
column4: Despite its fame, the pizza here is just average. It can also be greasy, depending on your choice of toppings. And then there's the wait -- very long, especially for lunch and on weekends.
Great pizza, must try the vodka pizza, they also offer half and half, so can try all different types. highly recommended!

We were a hungry bunch when we arrived and not knowing how big the pizzas were, we ordered 4 for the 4 of us and they were delicious! Thin crust with amazing toppings and so so good! These guys are legit !

column3: The Best Pizza, Service, Old- School Atmosphere!!!!!!
column4: I really enjoyed, Rubirosa! As a New Yorker, we are fortunate to have amazing choices, and, this old- time, it's 50+ years old, has the best pizza, very Sicilian, very delicious, in a famous location! check out the history of Little Italy, then, you'll know!
Excellent food,desserts & friendly staff! Had a great dinner & the desserts were fabulous too! Would definitely go back
Great pizza ( if you like thin crust) and a wonderful selection of pasta. Very fresh and authentic. Don’t be scared by the size of the pizza which can be shared and then share a plate of pasta.

A traditional trattoria? Not really. Pizzas are good but this is an artificial trendy place and staff is not friendly (best case) or unpleasant (worst case). Nothing in common with a warm and old fashioned trattoria.
The thin crust pizza was fabulous, and the desserts were all delicious. Service was outstanding, highly recommend Rubirosa if you’re ever in the neighborhood!!
This was the best pizza and pasta I ever experienced and I have been to many high end Italian restaurants. Highly recommended.
We had a great lunch here. Two large pizzas shared among three of us. A busy, cosy restaurant with great service, good food and excellent value.
I’ve been here 4 times and it never disappoints!!I’ve had the supreme pizza and la carbonara which is so good. Drinks are good as well!
Pizza was awesome. Beer was really good. Fun environment. Enjoyed my stop here. Found it via trip advisors
I wish we lived closer. I would go here once a week! The vodka sauce pizza is fantastic and a must try.
The best pizza ever!!! Fresh ingredients, just delicious. Great service in a very nice ambiance. Totally worth it

The gluten free pizza was the best I have ever eaten. They even added Pesto to my 'bianca' pizza despite that not being an option. I will definitely go back there and recommend to others with dietary issues.

Stumbled upon this place by accident for Sunday brunch. Place was packed but they were able to sit us right away. Ordered the vodka pizza, half pepperoni. It was amazing! Will definitely come back again and try more items from the menu.
Cosy location, excellent and friendly service and the food was very good. Order a small pizza, that’s completely enough together with starter. The restaurant is highly recommend!

Had a great lunch there having the Tie-Dye Pizza which is Pesto/Vodka/Tomato Sauce Pizza. It was outstanding...3 of us could have eaten 2 large pizzas!!! The Rubi salad was also very good. Highly recommend!!!
Staff and atmosphere were excellent and the food (especially the pizzas), outstanding. Book early and get ready for some serious portion sizes!
We stayed just a few blocks away in the Nobleden and was recommended this place. Amazing pizza and atmosphere!
I highly recommend this spot in Nolita. I was promised the best thin crust I had ever had and it was true. I also loved the calamari (super thick and yummy) and the rigatoni was so good.

The service and atmosphere were fine. We got our drinks and food quickly. However, the pizzas were rather boring and neutral. The air-con was very cold where we sat. We had to wear our coats and scarfs.

Friendly and helpful staff, nice location. Great and fast service (at least at lunch time). The pizzas are huge and delicious. Thin dough, which is my favorite. By far the best pizza I had in the city. I totally recommend!

column3: One of the best pizza i ever have
column4: Good ingredients, the taste was right.. along with a nice bottle of red wine. Nothing to blame. We had our pizza on take away but were totally happy about it. I would go back without hesitation.

We went to dinner with my boyfriend and food was great. I ordered spaghetti and my boyfriend chicken. And 2 glass of white wine. Everything delicious and not expensive. The attention was great and a very nice atmosphere. We expend less than 50dls.

This place is authentic Italian in Little Italy. Couldn't be better. Quite simply the best pizza you will ever taste. Get the "small" pizza between two. To call it small is ridiculous. It was delicious as was the Negroamaro wine.
We had the rice balls and pizza. Both were excellent. Loved the ambiance inside too! Wait was only about 30 min on a Sat afternoon.
Rubirosa Is very good, but didn't live up to all the hype. They are known for their pizza and homemade pasta; both were fine, but not outstanding. They were packed and noisy. Server was very good.
Absolutely best pizza!! You will love it. The sauce is amazing. The atmosphere is really neat. This is a must if you come to little Italy.

column3: Meat ball sandwich and dessert-Calm and quaint in Rubirosa
column4: Sit at the bar....is this place in Little Italy? Close enough!...great sandwich...good beers...good people behind the bar. Calm and quaint.
Absolute amazing food and service! They had a blue crab spaghetti that was to die for! All my family loved their entrees! Great service and ambience!!!!
This place is epic. The vodka tomato pizza base is unbelieveable. Every time I visit from New Zealand this is the first place I go to. Have never tasted pizza this good anywhere else in the world.
Fantastic food. Enough said! Go here. Pizza great, salads unremarkable. Brick oven pizza. Would go back tomorrow if I were still there! A must people. A must!! Go early to avoid the wait.
Nice thin crust pizza with delicious sauce. Been in NY all my life and this is one of the best pizzas i've had. Classic with mushrooms. Staff was friendly as service was prompt. Highly recommend

I was Last week at rubirosa... we waited 40 minutes for a table.. it was like they didnt wanna give us a table.. the woman at the entrance was soooo unfriendly... Never saw that in my life... Never again i will eat at this Place...
Delicious homemade pastas, insanely delicious pizzas- it's ALL about that sauce! Sit near the kitchen & see the masters at work.

column3: Ricotta Bruschetta is to DIE for!
column4: Ricotta Bruschetta is to DIE for! The vodka pizza is fantastic as well. Tried several slices, all were great. Will come back every time I return!

Rubirosa have good, thin crust pizzas, however coming from Europe I have had better Italian pizza. Also I was not impressed with the Vodka sauce. The place has an ok atmosphere. It is a little dark for my taste.

column3: Great intro to New York Pizza
column4: We ate there on a Thursday evening. Was told it would be at least an hour wait. We maybe waited 45. Ordered a small pepperoni pizza and caprese salad for two. The mozzarella was amazing. Service was quick and friendly and the restaurant was cozy.
Pizza was hot, fresh, and flavorful! Highly recommend. Only inconvenience is that there was 1 bathroom and the line was really long :/

Myself and my sister ate here, we ordered two different pizzas ( Rubirosa Supreme and Tye Dye pizza). Both were absolutely delicious. They boxed them up when we weren't able to finish them. Could not fault it. Service was also good.

Great off the beaten path gem in Little Italy. Pizza is second to none and very cool vibe with local atmosphere and decor. Good wine selection and good service. Very easy to see why it's always featured on "best pizza lists."

This place is small but well worth the wait. Every and I mean everything was delicious. YES even the gluten free menu. Try the rice balls, calamari, Octopus, black kale and the trio pizza all gluten free.

Always crowded and frequented by locals for their thin crust pizzas! Pastas are so fresh and authentic as well. Service can be a bit rushed and u attentive at times. If you can look past that then it's worth a visit!

went to juliana's before and few days after in here...no doubt the best pizza i ever eaten , thin and crispy and mouthwatering!! comes in huge slices so beware!!come on an empty stomach......definitely my favorite pizza in NYC!

We enjoyed an excellent lunch with another couple. The pizza was excellent and large. What stood out was the friendly waitress and efficient service. The restaurant is on the small size which added to the Italian ambiance. Desserts were also excellent.
Very nice place with an excellent pizza! Helpful stuff! The only negative thing is the small portions of pasta!
Not cheap but really great food and atmosphere. You need to get there early and leave your mobile/cell number and go to a bar for an hour or so
Upon arriving we had to wait about an hour to get a table, but if was worth every minute. The staff is excellent, especially the bartenders. It made a lasting impression, adding to my love for NYC.

You can't go to NYC and not try pizza can you? Gluten free pizza isn't always the easiest to find or the best. Let me introduce you to the awesomeness of Rubirosa. All items pictured are gluten free and fabulous!
Had never seen pizzas this size! Delicious. The rocket pizza was a hit! A small restaurant so you may have to wait for a table - but when it's located on such a lovely street that's no issue!
This has the best pizza in town I loved the environment and the Mozzarella sticks! But freaky I loved the mozzarella sticks! Service was good as well.

If you're looking for a pizza in NYC - come here. Great flavours, well cooked and good value for money.....they're huge! Book ahead though as it's very popular. The calamari to start was also very tasty. Just wish they delivered to the UK!

column3: great place for pizza in NYC
column4: I went there for pizza with a colleague and had a great time. This is an excellent place for NYC pizza. It is busy but worth the wait.

column3: YUM and almost worth the 3 hour wait
column4: Had a great Tye Dye Pizza and salad after waiting 3 hours for a table. Sometimes we do ANYTHING for our family. Great atmosphere! Lively, and great Jazz music.
A good time was had at the Rubirosa on Mulberry st. We had the daisy and uncle buck cocktails and the tie-die pizza and enjoyed all three immensly.
Another fun place to have a pizza in NYC. Top notch service looks bigger inside. Pizza was nice thin and crispy.
Second time here in the past two years & still amazing. The large house pizza and pastas are fabulous. Service was great and we loved the small intimate feeling of the place.

I have been here for a slice during the day and dinner at night, travelling solo or with my wife, each time it's been perfect. A must visit for every time I come to NYC. Relax, have a beer and an amazing pizza.

As a coeliac I've always struggled to find good Italian food. This place was amazing, with a great GF selection and the pizza was the best I've ever had. For all coeliacs I would definitely recommend.

column3: Rubirosa is a JOKE and oh so RUDE
column4: I wouldn't go to this restaurant again if someone paid me. The hostess was extremely rude. No food is worth the rudeness.
If you like Pizza and you are craving for a good meal after shopping in SoHo try the Rubirosa. The pizza dishes are very tasty.
This is my favorite pizza place in NYC. Thin crust and awesome. Always crowded, be prepared to wait. Super spot in Little Italy.
Delicious, nice place, good music, excellent service. But don't forget to make a reservation. You most try the pizzas.

I really like the atmosphere here, very cozy, and the food is delicious. We shared the meatballs for an appetizer and they were fantastic, then shared a pizza, which was also great. Highly recommended.
Stopped in literally at random and - we got lucky! Just a couple glasses of wine and some really outstanding pizza. We tried the classic and the pesto pizzas - perfection!!

We stumbled upon this after searching "gluten free Little Italy" after Chinese NY parade. Amazing food, we sat at the bar for 30 minutes as they were crowded. They tease your senses with the aroma of garlic bread, pizza, espresso and down home Italian family...More

column3: Highly Recommend this Italian Restaurant north of Little Italy
column4: We were a party of five and ordered several dishes to share: Delicious thin crusted pizza, Rubirosa salad (which was huge), roasted octopus, eggplant parmigiano, black and white tagliatelle, mini rice balls, ricotta ravioli. All were excellent and the portions were large. For dessert we got one order of zeppole which was excellent but was such a generous portion that there was enough for all of us. Only negative comments: The restaurant had lost our reservation, but fortunately was able to seat us a half hour later; and the table where we were seated was near the front door and every time someone entered we got a cold blast of air. The noise level is a bit high but we still could have a conversation.

I was walking by Little Italy and searched online for a good restaurant to have pizza there. The app suggested Rubirosa, the second best place to eat pizza in NY. The first, according to the app, is in Brooklyn. So The place is adorable, great atmosphere and staff. The pizza wasn't the best ever but it was good.
This is my favorite pizza place in NYC. Thin crust and awesome. Always crowded, be prepared to wait. Super spot in Little Italy.
Delicious, nice place, good music, excellent service. But don't forget to make a reservation. You most try the pizzas.

I really like the atmosphere here, very cozy, and the food is delicious. We shared the meatballs for an appetizer and they were fantastic, then shared a pizza, which was also great. Highly recommended.

Whoever rate it less than five, should visit the doctor. :) It is one of the best Italian restaurants I have ever been to, and I have probably been to no less than 100. The pizza is superb! The service was good! The prices are very affordable (NYC after all). I took the signature dish - chicken. WOW!!! Definitely will visit again and again.

What a great find ! We had the tie dye pizza which consists of tomato and alla vodka sauce , pesto and fresh mozzarella. Best pizza we've ever had. The cavetelli with sausage and broccoli rabe was amazing. So fresh ! Tiramisu for desert was the perfect ending to this fabulous meal. Can't wait to go back !
Stopped in literally at random and - we got lucky! Just a couple glasses of wine and some really outstanding pizza. We tried the classic and the pesto pizzas - perfection!!

column3: Amazing little find and one of the best meals in New York
column4: Visited purely from the reviews on Trip Advisor and was not disappointed. What a great little restaurant. Staff were very friendly, food was reasonably priced and food was amazing. Seriously one of the best pasta dishes I've ever had and one of the best meals we had in New York. Definitely worth a visit and would highly recommend.

This is a little restaurant that we happened to try while walking around. We were surprised to how amazing the food was. The service was not that wow, but the food definitely covered it all. The pizza is delicious!!! I recommended it to many.
Amazing pizza and service!! We will definitely go back when we visit NY again. It's a must if you like pizza, you will no regret it!
Gluten free mozzy sticks. Gluten free pasta. Celiac -- and never got sick. Did over eat because it was all so very good. I wish I lived closer so I could eat there all the time!!

We wanted to try authentic Italian food while visiting NYC. This didn't disappoint. Their fried mozzarella was delicious, fresh and not greasy. It simply melted in my mouth. Their pizza was delicious too.

column3: Best gluten free pizza I have ever had !
column4: I have been looking for a good gluten free pizza for years and finally I have found it! Great staff and service. Totally worth the wait time

This place had been recommended to me and it lived up to its expectations. The food tasted authentic Italian, and my pizza was excellent, but too big which suited the rest of my family! Go along and have a great meal and an enjoyable night.
I don't go to NYC without coming to my favourite restaurant. Their pasta is always amazing, but a bottle of Lambrusco and their pizza is just the best part of my trip. Flawless.

Fabulous restaurant with a great gluten free menu! I was very pleased with the size of it!!! Gluten free pasta and pizzas!!! Dessert too! Flourless chocolate cake shown below - highly recommend eating here it's small and quaint with great food ...
very good! had pizza and a few other items. Great neighborhood spot. just filling space now to get to 100.

You have to wait for too long. They text you when in theory your table is ready and then they make you wait again outside! I dont know why I didnt go anywhere else. They brought food we hadnt ordered! So annoying
Great thin crust pizza. Highly recommend. Nice atmosphere. Family friendly. Salad really good too. !!!!!!!!
Pizzas here are very tasty and the crust is so nice. The vodka pizza is quite nice and the staff sre friendly. Would visit again
We had the Classic Pizza and black and white seafood tagliatelli pasta. It was delicious service was good the place was full buzzing and a proper taste of Italy in New York....

column3: I never knew pizza could taste so good
column4: We had the Rubirosa Supreme and arugula salad and it was delicious!!! I probably have pizza 2+ times a week but this was incredible! I don't even like arugula and the salad was good too. AMAZING! Melt in your mouth pure goodness!
The restaurant felt really cosy and relaxed. Pizzas were both huge and delicious, with lots of flavours on offer.
I ordered a pizza. Their basil is oddly minty and the cheese didn't melt right. Another dish was their ravioli, which was very average.
Was fortunate enough to meet a client near the restaurant and hence suggested it straight away. Still a great option for lunch or dinner with in my opinion the best pizzas in town!

column3: The best pizza pasta in NYC
column4: Really. Unassuming. Terrific food and service. You won't go wrong. Carbonara. Vodka pizza. Tiramisu. Old school.
Fantastic pepperoni pizza, delicous! Good service and nice atmosphere. I can really recommend this place.

column3: De vodka pizza is to die for!!!!!
column4: Really recommend you stop by. The pasta is really good. And the vodka pizza OMG!!!!!!!!!!!! The suprema is also awesome!!

We just love this little cozy place! The service is excellent, and the food is well worth the almost certain wait. Don't get discouraged though, it's usually a shorter time than they tell you. Get a pizza for sure!
We went the friday before July 4th weekend thinking it would be less busy. Nope. We waited for about 40 minutes but it was worth it. The Lasagne was absolutely delicious!

Absolutely LOVE the pizza here!! Obviously other people do too! This place was crowded and everyone had pizza on their table. Outstanding caprese salad! The mozzarella was very fresh! Reminded me of the mozzarella I had in Italy. Great service too!
Go for the pizza, stay for the Sunday Sauce with handmade pasta. I've visited this restaurant many, many times and every detail is perfect. One of my favs!

column3: Great thin crusted pizza and pasta
column4: Make sure you make a reservation. We snatched the last 10:15 reservation the night before and arrived at 10. They say is right away. Great wine recommendation. Great experience.
This restaurant has a great atmosphere, so charming! The food is fantastic! My husband and I shared a pasta dish and roasted octopus. It was a delicious meal!!
Pizza was delicious, and very big, service was good and the desserts were amazing - I would recommend getting the cheese pizza followed by the small Italian donuts.
Amazing pizza and a great place to go with friends. Really hard to get a reservation so book in advance but totally worth it. Look at the size of these pizzas?! All of the appetizers are great too!!!
This could be my last meal! The food is amazing and it is a great scene. Very simple decor and really laid back. Hard to get into so plan to wait but it is worth it! Every last bite...
Nice place very good vibe. Stuff are nice and the food is very tasty. Not expansive. You will be more than satisfied. Better to come at the noon.

We went to Rubirosa based on a friend's recommendation and weren't disappointed! The baked clams were the perfect starter - butter, breadcrumb, parsley goodness! We tried the Fresca pizza - excellent sauce and crisp from the thin crust.
We liked the pizza the salad the drinks... Pretty much everything! Only i would be happier if the restroom is more clean!!!
This is so much more than just a pizza shop. It has wonderful Italian dishes at an affordable price. It is on my list to visit every time I'm in NYC. Pasta done to perfection.
Small restaurant, dim lights, might be packed but you can wait, it's not a long wait. The pizza was delicious with a nice thin crust. Try the Tie-Dye!

Just like a scene from Goodfellas. This place was full to the brim which was a good sign. We had classic pizza with meatballs which was enough for two of us. I tried the soda with cream which was refreshing. Good value and authentic.
This place was right near our hotel . Pizza was good and the staff friendly. Pizza toppings are fresh, dough is thin but not super thin, and its tastes "simple" as in natural ingredients were used.
Kniw it is good when 1.5 hour wait on a Wednesday. Small space, more bar..best food. Pasta with meatballs the best.

Fantastic pizza's, simply great little place full of nice and chilled guests. Service first class especially guidance on exactly how much pizza you need. The pizza's are huge and simply delicious. Can't recommend it enough. Tough to get s booking though.

column3: great place for friends or family dinner in nolita
column4: This is one of the best small, non-touristy places on the edge of little Italy. It's a neighborhood spot, and it does get crowded, but the pizzas, pastas, and the bracciole are worth waiting for. Very reasonable, and they do take out, too.
We had an amazing lunch at Rubirosa! The gluten free rice balls, gluten free mozzarella sticks, gluten free pizza with a thin crust... I'm drooling.. Just go!

Definitely very good crowd here, good sign The pizza is very classical, it can't be more simpler Not to the way of my liking, but it is a must have in new York I guessed Very small joint and quite busy, service us mediocre
My out of town friends found this place. Very popular place. Bar area was very busy. Pizza was great. Thin crust. Portions of the pasta dishes were large. Everything tasty.
We enjoyed our drinks, the calamari, the tye dye pizza, and the tiramisu. We were not able to get reservations but went anyway. They said 2 hour wait. As it turned out we were seated in 45minutes!
This lovely little restaurant serves excellent Italian food in a quaint little environment. The pizzas are excellent and the pastas are even better!
tHe service was great and helpful!! Great food and drinks. The pizza was amazing so was the pasta and meatballs. I GO EVERY YEAR FOR MY BIRTHDAY!!!
If you looking for good food , good atmosphere and not a tourist trap go to Rubisora. Loved to know how they make the tomato sauce.
A cool little Italian joint with amazing food. The staff was super nice and the service was prompt..

Rubirosa is small, but don't let a wait stop you. The food is fantastic. We had Lasagna, cavatelli with sausage, and the pizza is out of this wold. To top it off they served zeppelin with chocolate and raspberry sauces.
Outstanding thin crust pizza. Had the classic and it was, well, classic!!! Service was fast, nice casual, nearly old NYC feel. Would definitely recommend it to a true pizza lover.

For the genuine New York Italian food experience look no further. The food and venue is brilliant with the staff friendly and attentive. Do book and go as it's worth every penny and you will want to go back again

Amazing pizza, shared a small which we thought would not be enough but we were wrong. Great beer list. Service friendly It didn't feel cramped, more than enough space. We booked... Highly recommended!
My daughter is gluten intolerant so we had researched some places that could accomodate. Rubirosa did not disappoint! They also had Rice Balls and Mozzeralla sticks that were gluten free!
Nice and cozy.. But stick to pizza Marghrita.. Nothing else is worthy of the calories.. Casual and quick. Atmospheres is nice by the bar area and not the back.
I come here at lease once a week for their supreme pizza. It's so delicious. The crust is super thin, almost like crackers top with lots of meat toppings. Just how I like it.

column3: Nice Pizza even for italian people
column4: I ma Italian and I can grant that Pizza in this restaurant is really a good one. To all Italian people that are around Nolita neighbourhood, you can step in and eat a good flat crispy Pizza.One Big is enough for two people.
We ordered a pizza and it was so delicious! It seems to be an authentic italian pizza! The place was good too.

Went with part of my family for lunch. We had the tie dye pizza. It was very tasty. Thin crust, flavorful and more than enough (a large pie). The service was outstanding. The price point was what I expected.
The vodka pizza incredible, all an experience and after tagliatele fruti di mate. The best of the best. Very friendly the service.
Delicious pizza! Have the vodka pizza it's amazing! Arrived with friends, we were seated near the kitchen and it was way too hot so the hostess moved us. Service was great, food was great!
The best NY pizza I have ever had. Phenomenal service. Great wine selection and the digestivo selection is impressive.
awesome food but a small area. the restaurant is located on the north end of mulberry street and i think they have the best pizza in little italy

We visited Rubirosa for a lunch time meal and it was absolutely fantastic! Food was beautiful, had the supreme Rubirosa pizza which is the best I've ever had! Staff were all helpful and friendly, would highly recommend visiting here!
We had a terrific lunch in Little Italy. We came here because of GF options. It did not disappoint. The pizza expert in our group even gave it the thumbs up. Delicious.

We were recommended this restaurant and went for lunch. We were certainly not disappointed. The service was great and the food was exceptional. The waiter made good recommendations including ensuring we didn't over order. Would highly recommend.
Made reservations (a must) and were promptly seated. Had the Italian wedding soup which was outstanding! Pizza and pasta was equally good. Service was excellent too!
I loved this place. Great gluten free options. Pizza, Riceballs. Outstanding. Really really liked it. Service was good and nice location near Little Italy
Had a great saturday lunch time pizza. Was quite busy but the food was quickly served and was enjoyable. Very generous portions as you'd expect in the US. Recommended.

The wine list is excellent here and several fine bottles can be found at a reasonable price. They also have some special wines. We ordered pizza, and it is quite delicious. the service was excellent. We were quite pleased.
Great pizza, good beer, nice, friendly bar staff - nice buzzy atmosphere whether with others or on your own - worth the wait in the inevitable line out the door
Not sure how this could have been better. Service was excellent, pasta, pizza, and arugula salad were incredible. Lovely experience. Will be back.
Best place for pizza in what's left of Little Italy in Manhattan! Friendly service but be prepared for a long wait at busy times!
Beautifully cooked authentic food. Not one you stumble upon, so you need to have done your research and hunt it down. Impressed and relieved it lived up to the reviews we had read.
The best carbonara that I have eaten in my life!!!! For desert I recomend the fresh donuts... I've been there many times.... in my opinion this is the best italian restaurant in Manhattan..

Very quick and friendly service. We heard the star giving some very detailed explanations of the menus to other tables in response to questions. The food arrived quickly and was beautiful; portions were great.

column3: New York Style Pizza at it's best
column4: Really good for correct prices. Ask for the Classic Pizza (A big one is big enough for 3). The waiters are really nice.
The bracciole and the zeppoles are amazing!! Come here every time I'm in nyc! The pizza is great and absolutely love the lasagna. You cannot go wrong with anything in the menu! !

I don't know if this is "the best pizza in nyc" but it's the best pizza I've had. The ingredients are crazy fresh, the crust, tomato, mozzarella, meat... They have great beer on tap too. A place to recommend and we'll definitely go back sometime.
Great food. I was in NY for 6 days. I went to the restaurant 3 times. I had to keep going back. The food was so good. Pizza was good but you have to try Spinach Campanelle. It's incredible!
The menu offers a broad range of Italian classics. The pizza and pasta both strong offerings. Have been twice will be back. Great value decent wine list.

A very good restaurant. Food is superb. Cooked precisely al dente (for pasta) and pizza is perfect. Tasty, crunchy, generously filled. Service very friendly and fast. The general look of the place could use some attention.

column3: Great vibes here, good Italian food.
column4: Small but homely. The restaurant had friendly staff and great bartender. Ordered a pasta dish, and a drink. Price ran around $16 per dish and drinks around $12. Up to my standard IMO not bad! =3

Rubirosa is one of my favorite Italian restaurant in Soho. From their authentic sauces, and famous pizza's to their amazing spaghetti and meatballs!!! I CAN NOT WAIT TO GO BACK!!! THUMBS UP TO STEVE- BEST WAITER EVER!!!
I went there twice during my visit in september. The food is amazingly tasteful and beautifully served. Nice and friendly staff. I will surely return next time I'm in New York.
Probably the best pizza I have had in my life. Smaller place, but a great atmosphere. We had to wait for a little bit but they sent us a text when our table was ready.
The atmosphere was buzzy, the staff friendly and the food fantastic ! I can fairly say this is the best pizza I have tasted, thin crust and so light. I I will be highly recommending this restaurant.

Intimate, buzzy vibe, cozy and packed. We went on Monday night and it was full; hosts extremely helpful as were servers and bar staff. Pizzas were fantastic - well worth a visit for authentic NY pizza!

Amazing little haunt at Mulberry street in Soho. The small pizza is so large two people would find it difficult to finish unless Very Hungry. But delicious pizzas, great salads and in the dessert don't forget to ask for their Canoli. It's Fantastic!

The service in the restaurant was good. We waited very long before we got our meal, if you are very hungry don't expect to be served quickly. The music is a bit too loud. The food was delicious though.

column3: Great little place with awesome food
column4: Been there a few times for dinner , excellent service , have tried some other places in Little Italy and this is one of the best . That Vodka Pizza is awesome .......
Really great food, great atmosphere, no rush, what more could you want? If you want a great meal in Little Italy without falling into a tourist trap, look no further.

Had only a small wait but enjoyed an excellent meal, great pizza, great service, good price and good wine. I can not recommend this restaurant more highly. Please don't go there so we can enjoy the place by ourselves :-)

column3: Best pizza and I have tried them all!
column4: Delicious thin crested pizza and they will sell you a slice not just a whole pie. Lovely small place and the food looks as good as the pizza. Going to be back very soon!

column3: So good I don't mind the snooty hipster staff
column4: Terrific Italian, well priced. Very hard to get a table and very crowded when you do. For that reason I often get takeout from them.
Great food, atmosphere and location. Very reasonable too. It was exactly what was promised and a wonderful way to start our tour of NY.
I visited here with my hubby for a date night and we loved it. The pizza was delicious and I loved the italian peers. Highly recommend this place! It is totally worth the hype.

This is a great little Italian restaurant. Limited seating, dark atmosphere, but enjoyed the ambiance. We had rigatoni/sausage ragu and the supreme pizza and devoured every bite of both! We would definitely recommend to those traveling in the area.

Came here for a early dinner with some friends. We waited for about 20 minutes before getting a table. Absolutely delicious food, we ordered the fried Calamari and Arugula Pizza everything was divine and fresh.

If you are in the Village, go here for pizza! The crust is perfect and the sauce light and flavorful. The bartender is a bit surly but the waitstaff pleasant. Go early or be prepared to wait- but it's worth it!
We tried pizza classic and pasta with tomato sauce and meatballs and we loved both. The prices are fair for NY. It also works without reservation.
the pizza was very good new york pizza! the area was very beautiful in little Italy district in nyc. we had to wait about 30 minutes to get the table. but it was a worth of wait.
Best Italian meal I've ever had in NYC. Seriously. You must go here. Make reservations well in advance.

A little pricey for the location but I guess that's what you pay for the location. The pizza itself was good but not amazing. Not a typical New York style pizza. Not sure I'll go back as the place is small and warm.
Excellent meat balls & pasta. Great service and good atmsphere. Defo will eat there again. Plenty of water with little upselling.
Great local restaurant for the best pizza. Prefect amount of filling, cheese, crust thickness. Pizza are huge. Pasta was pretty good as well. Big groups book ahead.
Everything we ordered was absolutely delicious, we loved the dark old-style atmosphere, tight spaces but its NYC (who cares), every mouthful was great!

This place just has too many dishes to recommend from the baked clams, mamas bracioli to the spaghetti and meatballs! If I had a complaint it would be we did not listen to waiter who said we ordered too much!! Great place!

We visited this Italian restaurant in Mulberry street and ordered Arugula pizza and spinach campanile pasta. A cosy restaurant, lined up with wines stacked all around was nearly full. The food was delicious and recommended!
Crowded and noisy restaurant serving the best, thin, crispy crust pizza. Reservations are a must or expect a long wait.
Amazing service, very tasty (and typically New York style) pizza and salads! A different take on panacotta which was delicious.
Fantastic restaurant in little italy. Great food and a trendy atmosphere. We will definitely be going back!

I have travelled extensively to italy and have tasted some of the best food ever. The risotto in this restaurant was up there with the best!! Great atmosphere, great food, great service. Grazie Mille!!! Ciao a presto!!

column3: One of the best Pizza in New York!!!!
column4: Every time when I am in New York, I ate best Pizza in Rubirossa! Very very good food,not just Pizza, everything dessert, salad, what ever you eat, delicious food. Small, crowded but excellent food.
Everybody says that you won't find good italian food in Little Italy. This place proves them wrong. Great pizza and pasta, great atmosphere and friendly staff. Highly recommended!

column3: Perfect for NY Pizza and Nolita Chic
column4: Perfect blend of Little Italy and lower East Side chic. Delicious pizza, salad, and fun bar. Amazing for a nice weekend lunch w/ a glass of Rose.

column3: Small, and so hip it hurts!
column4: If you want a real neighborhood gem, this is the place! Just expect it to be packed. The food is truly artisanal with great salads, pizza and my favorite meatballs!!

We stopped in Little Italy for pizza and found this place. It was busy even at 2pm but we were seated immediately. We ordered a small pizza and it was delicious! Thin New York style crust. Service was very good.

First of all the portions were plentiful, and secondly delicious. Our waiter was very good, polite, efficient and even gave us recommendations afterwards for a speakeasy type bar. Quaint, comfy, and reasonably priced.
What an amazing place!! From the bread to the pasta to the service. All top notch. Just go...you won't regret it. Nothing else to say. Btw, expect to wait but, again, soooo worth it.
GO! You won't regret it. Awesome pizza shop with a equally as awesome atmosphere. Feels like you're a local in NYC while eating here. Highly recommend.

We went there and the place was packed, we had to seat at the bar or wait 1 hr We order the Vodka pizza, meatballs and the Rubirosa rigatonni. All where excellent The pizza has been one of the best I've tried in NYC
Top notch pastas and pizzas in a romantic environment. Very helpful service and a well chosen wine list. The braciole was craveworthy.
Great food at a good price place is alittle small make reservations we ordered alittle of everything and you were allowed to share really look foward to go back

column3: An absolute gem of a restaurant
column4: Amazing italian food, very busy but you can see why, locals seem to be eating there and I should imagine they go often. Highly recommended!!!!
Very busy very popular restaurant booking is a must!! Excellent gluten free Pizza and Pasta. Great service and great atmosphere.

Great pizza, rice ball appetizer, and drinks...this came highly recommended and food was as delicious as promised. We did not get the chicken parm but our neighbors did and it looked delicious and huge.
Had the vodka pie last night. Was good. Got cold very fast which surprised me. Worth a visit. Saw someone order the calamari appetizer. Looked good

Busy little place on a Thursday evening. Started with caesar salad then black and white pasta then finished with chocolate bread pudding ... each was very good, fresh and tasty! Service was excellent. Great find!!

column3: One of the best italian restaurant in the city
column4: Rubirosa is one of my favorite spot in the city. The food is great, especially pizzas, mozzarella sticks, eggplant parm and the cobblers. The staff is also extremely friendly and helpful. Unfortunately, it's always packed.

Inconspicuous Italian restaurant in Nolito, but very popular judging by the constant stream of patrons. Do yourself a favor and book online with opentable.com. We did and had a table waiting for us. Pizza crust is very thin and crunchy.
Tasty food and great atmosphere...a little on the expensive side. But worth paying for the quality of the food!
This lunch was way aboce our expectations, we were recommended this restaurant and the pasta was so good. We could not stop eating, can highly recommend this place

column3: Great food, reasonable prices, like to be a regular
column4: This is a great restaurant. Delicious food, reasonable prices, accommodating to families. Would go there regularly if I were local.

Trust me, you have to eat there! The food is of course excellent but the ambiance and service are just as great! Don't get tempted by the commercial and touristy options on the street on the way there, this place is simply the best.
Have eaten a lot of pizza in NYC and is by far the best I've ever had. The vodka tomatoe pizza sauce, mozzarella, pesto and pepperoni is amazing!!
Little but very trendy place for perfect pizzas and good wine. On the famous Mulberry Street but at a quieter corner distant from the tourist rush of the Little Italy.
Nice selection of pastas,pizzas, salads, very European type atmosphere, reservations is a must always full
We stopped at Rubirosa for lunch and had the tie-die pizza. The crust was wonderfully thin and crispy with a perfect blend of flavors on top.

The pizza and pasta are great, house wine is good. Vodka pizza may sound extreme but it was actually great, the seafood menu is very fresh. You have to book or go there early because this place is packed!
Asked for directions from a guy carrying pizza boxes. What a great find! Friendly staff. Relaxed atmosphere and delicious pizza. A definite to visit for a yummy meal in a charming location

Joined a bunch of friends for dinner there last night. Started with a few pizzas and we shared several mains. So much great food and our server made fantastic suggestions. Reasonable wines too. Great evening! Would recommend everyone goes.

Delicious food. Homemade pasta (need I even say any more?). Lots of variety but classic tasty Italian food. Great atmosphere and wonderful service. The desserts are heavenly (order one of each). Excellent service. Very well priced.
Excelent bar and restaurant, a little bit noise, but fair enough if you think that is a bar... Good drinks, good food... They have gluten free pizza... Good advice for celiacs...

The beet salad was amazing. Pizza was good too but salad outstanding. I had the tomato base pizza with prosciutto and capsicum/peppers. I would recommend getting the prosciutto as it was excellent but no peppers. The service was great and we thoroughly enjoyed the vibe!
The pizza, pasta and salad were nice, and the waiters fine, but the place is a bit loud and busy for my taste. House wine was average.
We ordered three different pizzas and we all loved the vodka pizza ! Would definitely order that again.
My wife and I went here based on the Trip Advisor reviews, and we were not disappointed!! The decor was just what you'd expect for Little Italy, and he food was excellent! The bruschetta was great!!
Delicious real Italian pizzas with a thin crust. Too big for us but a doggy bag was no problem. Situated in a cute neighborhood.
We went looking for a good pizza to eat. Nice and clean place. Staff were nice, the only bad thing was that the soda was a small tiny bottle. We want a big glass but other ways was good.
delicious pizza! no doubt, one of the best in NYC. friendly staff, reasonable price. highly recommended!

Went here with a Branding Staff and friends and had a ball. The food was super hot as served in temperature and was excellent. Our waiter did a good job, the beer was cold. Worth trying for certain go early it is packed

column3: Are you kidding go get this good Italian food.
column4: Had the rigatoni and pizza. It was fresh they make their own pasta. Everything was served hot which the way it should be. A little small and a little crowded but overall great New York City atmosphere.
The caprese salad to start was delicious, and then had the vodka pizza and supreme pizza and loved them both. It's cozy and the service is excellent. Excellent food!

Rubirosa was recommended by a newcomer to NYC. The food was excellent and our server (Chad) was extremely helpful. We all (7 of us) tried each other's lunch and enjoyed every dish. I would highly recommend !
This was hands down the best pizza I've ever had. We finished one pie and literally ordered a second!

Came here to have some great food which we had. Located in soho. Very charming restaurant with great food. We ordered the beer salad, spaghetti and vodka pizza. All were very delicious. Great restaurant to go to.

Nice small Italian restaurant ambiance. The meatballs for an appetizer were fantastic - could have had just that for a meal. Loved the cavatelli. We also had the Rubirosa supreme pizza - best pizza I had ever had! Would definitely return.

After a mix up with our reservation the staff were very accommodating. This is a fantastic restaurant with great food, a cosy and welcoming ambiance and the pizza's are amazing! Can not recommend highly enough
This pizza is very good and very thin, which leaves you less full (i.e. less sick when finishing off all the pizza). Fun ambiance, good neighborhood, I will definitely go back.

An absolute must - everything on the menu is delicious. Gets a bit crowded (it's an intimate space) but the ambiance is perfect for a date, a family dinner, or a birthday party. I recommend the ricotta ravioli, it's to die for!

The Gluten free choices were excellent and appreciated. All of the tastes were outstanding, but the Octopus was just out of this world. This was a must for excellent Italian food. All of our meals were well prepared and excellent and the service was good.

We were recommended this place by a total stranger and to our very pleasant surprise, everything surpassed expectations. Their pizzas are delicious (and huge!) and the risotto is mouth-watering. Their wine list is excellent and the service is very friendly.
All too perfect, service, very good taste, and specially very good price, comfortable and very easy to locate

The pizza here is similar to pizza in Italy. Very thin crisp cracker like crust. Excellent pizza. The antipasto was a wonderful assortment of meat, cheese, peppers, olives etc. very enjoyable. Staff excellent
Great ambiance and vary attentive service. The pizza i delicious and the salads are also very good. Great place to take friends or a significant other. The sausage broccoli rabe pizza is incredible.

Excellent pizza, salads, pasta and desserts. This place is going on to our "favorites" list. A great place for sharing dishes and many items come in sharing size or individual size. Suggest calling for a reservation as this is a hot spot.

Actually want there several times over the past few years (before F&W found it). Found it after shopping at Fluevog (Prince & Mulberry) for shoes. Try the arugula pizza with prosciutto - AMAZING! Good prices and service.
I love Rubirosa!! Anytime I have a guest in town I always bring them here. Beware of wait times and make a reservation if possible. Having said that the wait is worth it!
Excellent food and ambiance. The pizza and just everything I've ever had here is so yummers! Will definitely go back again!

Great food, atmosphere and service, the food comes in very generous portions with good selection of wines. Found out about this place through TripAdvisor reviews and I wasn't disappointed! I would go there when I in NYC again.
excellent ravioli, meatballs, and risotto. The zeppole were to die for, and the service was prompt and friendly
the pizza was excellent, the grilled peach salad appetizer was excellent. very nice service which was responsive and timely. prices are reasonable. warm and lively atmosphere.
Accidentally ordered a large Fresca pizza, and accidents ate the whole thing. Oops! Great place, but very crowded. I highly recommend waiting for a table.
Delicious thin crust pizza and fresh pasta. The staff could have been a little better - but the location and food were fantastic.

One of the best pizzas in Manhattan--crispy crust, sweet tomato sauce and amazing cheese and flavor. Delicious salads, sides and pasta, and quick friendly service make Rubirosa an overall excellent experience.

Everything we ordered was yum esp pizza! The homemade tomato sauce was great. Atmosphere was great, from the outside it doesn't look like much buy when you step inside it's another world. We explained a piccolo and they made them well!

I'm gluten free and time and time again (ok, almost weekly) I am thrilled with my dinner. Gluten free pizza and rice balls and pasta never ever disappoint. Truly. There is a reason that its impossible to get reservations. Fabulous!

Eating in NYC anywhere without a reservation on a weekend is challenging. There was no wait at Rubirosa even though it was full. The pizza was excellent, the service prompt, and it wasn't too expensive. Only one unisex bathroom.

column3: Meatballs, house salad and an IPA to wash it down. Perfect!
column4: Second time back. No doubt a third next time I'm in town. Meatballs and Rubirosa salad great early dinner treat.

for a relaxed atmosphere with great food that will not break the bank visit rubirosa. we really enjoyed the authentic and crusty pizza, broiled octopus appetizer, and friendly service. i will be back to rubirosa.

Came with my family and had great pizza and pasta. All were delicious! Only issue was there was one unisex bathroom for the entire restaurant. Expect to wait with each trip. But the food was terrific and the small, family owned feel was homey.

Greatest pizza I have tasted! It was so thin and light! Tasted amazing. The location is in the middle of little Italy. Cute small restaurant with great people working there. The cheese on the pizza was crazy good !
We went there based on the TripAdvisor ratings, and it was everything the comments said: excellent food, very friendly service, delicious pizzas. Definitely a place to return to.

Great food, great ambiance, great service, and good value!! Hard to beat that!! Pizza is so amazing (pepperoni was so good), and their salad was so fresh and delicious (fresh home made cheese!). I would move to NY just to eat here regularly!

Rubirosa is my favorite Italian restaurant in the Soho-Nolita area, friendly, trendy and above all always excellent food.Go for the Vodka Pizza, the Meatball Bruschetta, the Spaghetti alla Chitarra, or the Brick Pressed Chicken. And for brunch try the Nutella Bruschetta and the Eggs Rubirosa.

Met a local woman who made the recommendation, was the weekend highlight. Ordered a small pizza for two and it was enough for my wife and I. Try the fresh uncooked mozzarella, pesto and tomatoes pizza, unbelievable!
Spent a year in Manhattan in 2011 and became slightly obsessed with the pasta at Rubirosa. Small place but great ambience, friendly staff and the bread, the pasta, the wine - all just incredible.
Another restaurant we found because of Trip Advisor. Had a real New York feel to it, very young atmosphere. Food was of excellent quality and professional service. Thoroughly recommend it.

Best pizza in New York!!! Been there multiple times and loved dinning at the bar. Pasta dishes are not that great (definitely much better than other places in NY), not to mention the coctail list. Taste the Pisco Punch, great summer taste!

column3: Why go to NYC to hope to have wonderful meals? Because you will!
column4: Recommended by a friend who lives in NYC, Rubirosa is a great place to have a wonderful reasonably priced meal. Number one appeal factor, no tourists! That's one great sign. The atmosphere is what you would expect from being in Nolita, a small, authentic and welcoming place. I tried the roasted octopus which was wonderful. Some pieces were a bit chewy (the problem with cooked octopus), but most were little bites of heaven. With a bit of mache, tomatoes, roasted almonds... perfect combination. Then the classic pizza. Hard to describe. The crust is thin, cracking and buttery. The tomatoes are sweet and tangy (is that even possible?), the mozza is melting in your mouth. Also tried the cavatelli (my motto is, if there are homemade cavatelli, you have to have them--same with gnocchi; they have both, but don’t serve the gnocchi for lunch). They were perfectly cooked with a hint of garlic; the broccoli was a bit bitter, but just enough to marry the flavor of the bits of sausage. All of that accompanied by the house wine (white--2010 Borgo M. Friulano) with citrus nose and fresh taste. Perfect for this lunch. If I only had a bit more appetite to try more items on the menu... I guess I'll have to go back!

column3: A Pizza That Gets Better With Each Bite
column4: My wife and I went to Rubirosa during our Christmas season trip into Manhattan. We saw great reviews on Yelp, Tripadvisor, and in New York Magazine and made a decision to eat a pizza for lunch. The restaurant is very easy to find, just being a block from the Spring Street #6 subway stop. We ordered an appetizer of fried calamari and a small fresca pizza. The circles and tentacles of the calamari were crisp, lightly breaded, and not greasy and were served with a small cup of delicious marinara sauce. The pizza was unlike any we’ve ever eaten. The crust was flavorful, very thin, and crisp. A slightly chunky tomato/pizza sauce covered the crust with wonderful globs of fresh mozzarella scattered about and topped with chopped bits fresh basil. There were small bowls of oregano, crushed red peppers, and parmesan for sprinkling. The amazing thing about the pizza was that it got better with each bite. Our only mistake was ordering the small instead of the large pizza. Our server was very good and placed a carafe of water on the table before taking our drink orders. The pizza was one of the finest tastes we enjoyed during a 5 day trip.

Most Italian restaurants in Little Italy come up short on food quality. Not this one. We decided to try Rubirosa last Friday night. Our party of four could not get reservations but decided to drop by and see how long the wait was. Intitially we were told 30 - 45 min. Not bad. They took our cell number and said they'd call when our table was ready. Before we walked out the door they told us a table was available. The rest of the meal was as delightful. Homemade ravioli for two was over the top. Woke up the next morning thinking about it. Salads were fresh and flavorful. Wait staff was attentive and knowledgable. Will definitely go back next time we're in NYC.

Loved this place, it has a really natural feel and an artisinal flair. Good value in a relatively prime location, chilled out atmosphere and friendly service. Low key but high quality, the mixed greens were really fresh and had crunch and flavor, and the cavatelli with brocolli and sausage was a safe dish done really well. I'll be back!

I love Italian food and my husband is gluten-free - this usually means that I get my "Italian-fix" when I'm dining out with someone other than my husband! Well, Rubirosa has an extensive gluten-free menu. My husband had homemade gluten-free pasta that is to-die-for along with gluten-free meatballs - delicious! All of their pasta dishes are available in half-size portions too which is so great when you don't want to down an entire plate of pasta. Atmosphere and service was spot-on too.
If you are not from NYC don't go there unless you want to have a poor service but nice food.

Went here on the recommendation from Eric, the concierge at Trump SoHo. This small place is not much to look at but the pizza rocks! If you like thin crust pepperoni then this is your place. They sell by the slice and full pizzas.  We hit Lombardi's the next day and while it was excellent, we preferred the Rubirosa pizza.
